title: Sprint on plant model components development
description:
The approach chosen in MODEXTREME is to use several modelling solutions as they are, and adding new models to account for extreme events to such modelling solutions. This can be achieved, avoiding duplication, by implementing modelling solutions at fine granularity in the same platform, in this case BioMA. The workshop follows the hands-on training on BioMA of 2014 in Milan (see workshop material), and the workshop on the conceptual model for BioMA implementation of 2015 in Cordoba (see workshop material).

The hackathon crew on AcquaCrop, Grapes, Olivecan, Poplar, SiriusQ model component implementation ready for a break! pic.twitter.com/lO38JrISsI

— BioMA Modelling (@BioMAFramework) May 6, 2015

https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js

Format
The format will be based on short presentations, but mostly on autonomous team work for each of the modelling solutions under development. Marcello, Simone, and Argyris will provide assistance on BioMA specifics to different teams.
The last day each team is invited to make a short presentation introducing the goal of the sprint and the achievements of the week.

Social events
1. Bike tour downtown (and lunch) at lunch break (Wednesday 5th) – we provide the bikes!
2. Social dinner at 20:00 (Thursday 6th) – sorry, not paid by the project.

Survival guide
Instructions for the workshop, incl. how to reach the venue; software installations; computer requirements; and traveling hints.
